title: Activating lattice oxygen by a defect-engineered Fe2O3–CeO2 nano-heterojunction for efficient electrochemical water oxidation
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE01588F, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Qiuping Huang, Guang-Jie Xia, Bo Huang, Dongling Xie, Jianan Wang, Dan Wen, Dunmin Lin, Chenggang Xu, Lei Gao, Zhenduo Wu, Jinqi Wu, Fengyu Xie, Wenhan Guo, Ruqiang Zou
Self-supporting Fe2O3–CeO2 nano-heterojunction electrodes with rich oxygen vacancies present high catalytic performance for oxygen evolution reaction, where defect-engineering promotes the interfacial interaction and activates the lattice oxygens.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
